stories.text:
I'm coming to the end of a non-compete and I'm going to start looking for a new position in the next couple of months. I'm planning on using a recruiter as part of my job search, since the industry I'm looking in is rather fragmented.

I get one or two cold emails from tech recruiters on LinkedIn every week, often from different recruiters at the same couple of agencies.

How do I choose a good recruiter? What do you look for as red flags or positive signals?
stories.title: Ask HN: How to choose a tech recruiter, as a candidate?
World Population: Go Big or Go Small?

Why Europeans Took So Long to Learn the Crawl

stories.text:
I want to learn medicine. Is there a book you can recommend that reads so simple anyone would understand?

I basically don't know anything about medicine and would like to learn it.
stories.title: Ask HN: Best “ELI5” book to learn medicine?
Artificial Intelligence and Autonomy in the Militaries of NATO Members [pdf]
